constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 22 (Friday, February 5, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. MASSIE:
H.R. 899.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, section 8 of the United States Constitution sets
forth Congress's enumerated powers, and the Tenth Amendment
to the U.S. Constitution states that the powers not delegated
to the United States by the Constitution, nor prohibited by
it to the states, are reserved to the states respectively, or
to the people.
[Page H470]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

title: To terminate the Department of Education.
